course.subject: MATH
course.name: Computational Fluid Dynamics for Inviscid Flows
course.description: Derivation of the Navier-Strokes equations; the Euler equations; Lagriangian vs. Eulerian methods of description; nonlinear hyperbolic conservation laws; characteristics and Riemann invariants; classification of discontinuity; weak solutions and entropy condition; Riemann problem; CFL condition; Godunov method; artificial dissipation; TVD methods; and random choice method.

reviews.author: Nicknick:)
reviews.title: excellent
reviews.comment_content: Foundation knowledge of CFD. Shock wave and rerafrection wave. Based method to solve them. Euler equation.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. XU is excellent but you have to be concentrated in his class and ask questions
reviews.comment_grading: Good, but you need to attend the class and ask questions. The final exam is oral, but actually it is more difficult than written exam if you do not pay attention in the class and only finishing homework.
reviews.comment_workload: 5-6 homeworks. Actually they are not easy, but you can ask any questions and Prof. Xu will tell you more about questions. Definitely you can learn a lot as long as being active.

reviews.author: Aaronak
reviews.comment_content: It is based on the finite difference method basically. It focused on physical laws, not just numerical skills. it is deep but not very broad and it is good for understand the foundation of knowledge
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching speed is ok and the professor is good at the background knowledge. it is interesting to know the history of CFD and scientific rumors of the famous scholars in this area
reviews.comment_grading: A grade is hard to get, but it really depends on the final oral exam. it is not difficult but need to understand the material really.
reviews.comment_workload: it is fine, just some simple homework and short coding project

reviews.author: MrPotato
reviews.title: Computational Fluid dynamics
reviews.comment_content: The content is good enough but quite hard to grasp, specially if you are coming from an engineering background with not so much hands on experience with CFD. But overall the content is quite comprehensive for somebody with the appropriate background.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor is coming from solely mathematical point of view. And with that background, teaching might be very good. But for my engineering background, it did not sit well with me since there was no relation to physical processes and phenomenons. If somebody is coming from an engineering background, he/she may need to be cautious.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading was lenient as I opted for pass/fail. But usually there is an oral exam with even/odd questioning type.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not too much. You get some practice questions for your own sake and a couple of mini projects that need to be submitted.
